Description: Quartz var crystal (rock crystal) cylinder seal; standard presentation scene; worshipper being led by a goddess before a deity who sits on a throne beneath a crescent moon; the worshipper and seated deity both wear crested caps. Line border around the bottom of the seal; thre line inscription; chipped at top.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (16)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
